title: Advanced Cassandra Operations with Kubectl and Flux
description:
In this video Aaron Ploetz demonstrates essential Cassandra operations while using Kubectl and Flux. First, he builds up a new cluster and prepares it for use with only kubectl commands. Then, he introduces Flux and shows how to add a node to an existing Cassandra cluster, simply by submitting a PR in GitHub!

Chapters:
00:00:56 1. Mission Control "Expert Mode"
00:02:05 2. Create a cluster with kubectl apply
00:07:01 3. kubectl get secrets
00:08:52 4. kubectl expose service
00:10:07 5. Testing the service endpoint
00:12:26 6. Introduction to Flux
00:13:01 7. Flux & GitHub configuration
00:14:12 8. Flux bootstrap
00:15:53 9. Add a Cassandra cluster to Flux
00:16:50 10. Add a new Cassandra node

Flux website: https://fluxcd.io/
Explore next steps for your Apache Cassandra deployment: https://www.datastax.com/modernize-apache-cassandra-workloads
_________

Additional Resources:
- DataStax Developer Hub: https://datastax.com/devs
- DataStax Blog: https://www.datastax.com/blog/technical-how-tos
- Langflow: https://langflow.datastax.com
- Astra DB: https://astra.datastax.com
____________________

Stay in touch:
- Join our Discord Community: https://discord.gg/datastax
- Follow us on X: https://x.com/DataStaxDevs
